Distributions

Source: vignettes/distributions.Rmd
distributions.Rmd

These are the currently implemented distributions.

Name univariateML function Package Parameters Support
Cauchy distribution mlcauchy stats location,scale ℝ\mathbb{R}
Gumbel distribution mlgumbel extraDistr mu, sigma ℝ\mathbb{R}
Laplace distribution mllaplace extraDistr mu, sigma ℝ\mathbb{R}
Logistic distribution mllogis stats location,scale ℝ\mathbb{R}
Normal distribution mlnorm stats mean, sd ℝ\mathbb{R}
Student t distribution mlstd fGarch mean, sd, nu ℝ\mathbb{R}
Generalized Error distribution mlged fGarch mean, sd, nu ℝ\mathbb{R}
Skew Normal distribution mlsnorm fGarch mean, sd, xi ℝ\mathbb{R}
Skew Student t distribution mlsstd fGarch mean, sd, nu, xi ℝ\mathbb{R}
Skew Generalized Error distribution mlsged fGarch mean, sd, nu, xi ℝ\mathbb{R}
Beta prime distribution mlbetapr extraDistr shape1, shape2 (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Exponential distribution mlexp stats rate [0,∞)[0, \infty)
Gamma distribution mlgamma stats shape,rate (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Inverse gamma distribution mlinvgamma extraDistr alpha, beta (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Inverse Gaussian distribution mlinvgauss actuar mean, shape (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Inverse Weibull distribution mlinvweibull actuar shape, rate (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Log-logistic distribution mlllogis actuar shape, rate (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Log-normal distribution mllnorm stats meanlog, sdlog (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Lomax distribution mllomax extraDistr lambda, kappa [0,∞)[0, \infty)
Rayleigh distribution mlrayleigh extraDistr sigma [0,∞)[0, \infty)
Weibull distribution mlweibull stats shape,scale (0,∞)(0, \infty)
Log-gamma distribution mllgamma actuar shapelog, ratelog (1,∞)(1, \infty)
Pareto distribution mlpareto extraDistr a, b [b,∞)[b, \infty)
Beta distribution mlbeta stats shape1,shape2 (0,1)(0, 1)
Kumaraswamy distribution mlkumar extraDistr a, b (0,1)(0, 1)
Logit-normal mllogitnorm logitnorm mu, sigma (0,1)(0, 1)
Uniform distribution mlunif stats min, max [min,max][\min, \max]
Power distribution mlpower extraDistr alpha, beta [0,a)[0, a)

This package follows a naming convention for the ml*** functions. To access the documentation of the distribution associated with an ml*** function, write package::d***. For instance, to find the documentation for the log-gamma distribution write

?actuar::dlgamma

Problematic Distributions

Lomax Distribution

The maximum likelihood estimator of the Lomax distribution frequently fails to exist. For assume κ→λ−1x¯−1\kappa\to\lambda^{-1}\overline{x}^{-1} and λ→0\lambda\to0. The density λκ(1+λx)−(κ+1)\lambda\kappa\left(1+\lambda x\right)^{-\left(\kappa+1\right)} is approximately equal to λκ(1+λx)−(λ−1x¯−1+1)\lambda\kappa\left(1+\lambda x\right)^{-\left(\lambda^{-1}\overline{x}^{-1}+1\right)} when λ\lambda is small enough. Since λκ(1+λx)−(λ−1x¯−1+1)→x¯−1e−x¯−1x\lambda\kappa\left(1+\lambda x\right)^{-\left(\lambda^{-1}\overline{x}^{-1}+1\right)}\to\overline{x}^{-1}e^{-\overline{x}^{-1}x}, the density converges to an exponential density.

eps <- 0.1
x <- seq(0, 3, length.out = 100)
plot(dexp, 0, 3, xlab = "x", ylab = "Density", main = "Exponential and Lomax")
lines(x, extraDistr::dlomax(x, lambda = eps, kappa = 1 / eps), col = "red")
